thread.title: SEC Football by the Numbers Top 10 for Week 7: Alabama on Game 7 streak
thread.title_full: SEC Football by the Numbers Top 10 for Week 7: Alabama on Game 7 streak | AL.com

author: Mark Inabinett | minabinett@al.com
title: SEC Football by the Numbers Top 10 for Week 7: Alabama on Game 7 streak
text:
0 TDs were scored against Florida in its two SEC road games this season. The Gators are the only team in the nation that has played at least two away games without giving up a TD in them. Florida has defeated Kentucky 14-9 and Missouri 21-3 in its road games this season. The Gators visit LSU on Saturday.
2 Of the four teams in the nation that have not thrown an interception this season are SEC members. Neither LSU nor Mississippi State has had a pass intercepted in 2015. The other teams are Florida State and Memphis, which plays Ole Miss on Saturday.
3 Points have been scored against both Alabama and LSU in the first quarter this season, tied for the fewest allowed in the nation. On Saturday, Alabama visits Texas A&M, which has outscored its opponents 63-20 in the first quarter this season, and LSU hosts Florida, which has outscored its opponents 58-20 in the first quarter this season.
5 Consecutive seasons with a home win over an AP top-10 team for LSU. The Tigers beat No. 5 Alabama in 2010, No. 3 Arkansas in 2011, No. 3 South Carolina in 2012, No. 9 Texas A&M in 2013 and No. 3 Ole Miss in 2014 at Tiger Stadium. No. 8 Florida visits Baton Rouge on Saturday.
7 Losses so far this season for the six teams remaining on LSU's schedule, giving the Tigers the toughest remaining schedule in the nation, according to NCAA rankings. After facing undefeated Florida on Saturday, LSU plays Western Kentucky, Alabama, Arkansas, Ole Miss and Texas A&M to complete its regular-season schedule.
FOR MORE OF OUR COMPREHENSIVE COVERAGE OF THE SEC, GO TO OUR SEC PAGE
13 Consecutive seasons have featured an Alabama victory in the Crimson Tide's seventh game. Alabama's most recent loss in Game No. 7 came in a 35-24 defeat by Tennessee on Oct. 20, 2001. The Tide visits Texas A&M on Saturday for its seventh game of 2015. Last year in its seventh game, Alabama defeated the Aggies 59-0.
31 Years since the previous time a coach began his tenure at Florida with six consecutive victories. The Gators' 21-3 victory over Missouri last week put Jim McElwain at 6-0 in his first season with Florida, matching Galen Hall's start in 1984. Hall won his first nine games after being named Charley Pell's replacement three games into the 1984 season. McElwain is the first SEC coach to win his first six games since Houston Nutt won his first eight at Arkansas in 1998.
61 Meetings between Ole Miss and Memphis when the teams square off on Saturday, and this year's game will be the first in which the Tigers are ranked when taking on the Rebels. Memphis is No. 22 in this week's coaches poll. Ole Miss is ranked No. 12 in the coaches poll and No. 13 in the AP poll this week. Saturday's game will be the first in Memphis history involving two ranked teams.
94.6 Points is the combined per-game scoring average of Ole Miss and Memphis, which square off on Saturday. Memphis ranks fourth nationally with a scoring average of 47.8 per game. Ole Miss is fifth at 46.8. Each team has scored more than 50 points in a game three times this season. Memphis' 239 points this season are more than the Tigers have scored in any five consecutive games in school history.
1,025 Passing yards and 1,025 rushing yards have been gained by South Carolina's offense this season. The Gamecocks have thrown 161 passes and have 217 rushing attempts.
